qas.question: Which politican left the presidential race after supporting a boycott by voters?
How long did the presidential term become under the new constitution?
When was the new constitution ratified?
When was an end brought to the fighting between the government and Ntumi's rebels?
Who won more than 90% of the vote?
When did Bernard Kolelas win the election?
What did Lissouba advise his supporters to do?
What did international observers see no problem with?
What reduced the president's term to seven years?

context: In the controversial elections in <b5_0>2002<b5_0/>, <b4_0>Sassou<b4_0/> won with almost 90% of the vote cast. His two main rivals, Lissouba and Bernard Kolelas, were prevented from competing and the only remaining credible rival, Andre <a0_0>Milongo<a0_0/>, advised his supporters to <b6_0>boycott the elections<b6_0/> and then withdrew from the race. A <b8_0>new constitution<b8_0/>, agreed upon by referendum in <a2_0>January 2002<a2_0/>, granted the president new powers, extended his term to <a1_0>seven years<a1_0/>, and introduced a new bicameral assembly. International observers took issue with the organization of the <b7_0>presidential election<b7_0/> and the constitutional referendum, both of which were reminiscent in their organization of Congo's era of the one-party state. Following the presidential elections, fighting restarted in the Pool region between government forces and rebels led by Pastor Ntumi; a peace treaty to end the conflict was signed in <a3_0>April 2003<a3_0/>.
